column1:
4.2.4.3.2.6.1	Summary of evidence and recommendations for other treatments for uncomplicated stress 
urinary incontinence
Failure rates of single-incision slings appear higher than with other types of MUS.

The incidence of repeat surgery is higher in those women who underwent primary transobturator 
compared to retropubic MUS.

The five-year failure rate of Burch colposuspension appears higher than for synthetic or traditional 
sling procedures.

Some studies suggest that retropubic synthetic MUS procedures appear to be more effective than 
transobturator MUS for the treatment of recurrent SUI, but this is not a consistent finding in the 
literature.
Most procedures are less effective when used as second-line procedures.

Burch colposuspension has similar short-term patient-reported or objective cure rates when 
compared to TVT for treatment of recurrent SUI.
Autologous sling appears superior to Burch colposuspension for treatment of recurrent SUI.
